    3107            0 :                                     (sl[0] == '/' && sl[1] == '.' &&
    3108            0 :                                      (sl[2] == '/' || sl[2] == '\0'))) {
    3109              :                                         /*
    3110              :                                          *     flg  len
    3111              :                                          *    +----+----+
    3112              :                                          *    | 02 | 00 | CURRENT component.
    3113              :                                          *    +----+----+ (".")
    3114              :                                          */
    3115            0 :                                         if (nc != NULL) {
    3116            0 :                                                 cf = nc++;
    3117            0 :                                                 *cf = 0x02; /* CURRENT */
    3118            0 :                                                 *nc++ = 0;

    3133            0 :                                                 cl = nc++;

    3135              :                                         } else

    3140            0 :                                                 continue;

    3142              :                                 }

    3145            0 :                                         *nc++ = sl_last;
    3146            0 :                                         (*cl) ++;
    3147              :                                 }
    3148            0 :                                 sllen++;
    3149              :                         }

    3151            0 :                                 length = 5 + sllen;

    3154              :                                          * Mark flg as CONTINUE component.

    3179              :                                 }
    3180              :                         } else {
    3181            0 :                                 length = 5 + sllen;
    3182            0 :                                 if (bp != NULL) {
    3183            0 :                                         bp[3] = length;
    3184            0 :                                         bp[5] = 0;
    3185            0 :                                         bp += length;

    3187            0 :                                 extra_tell_used_size(&ctl, length);

    3189              :                         }

    3191              :         }
    3192              : 
    3193              :         /* Write "TF" System Use Entry. */
    3194            0 :         if (rr_flag & RR_USE_TF) {
    3195              :                 /*
    3196              :                  *   "TF" Format:
    3197              :                  *               len  ver
    3198              :                  *    +----+----+----+----+-----+-------------+
    3199              :                  *    | 'T'| 'F'| XX | 01 |FLAGS| TIME STAMPS |
    3200              :                  *    +----+----+----+----+-----+-------------+
    3201              :                  *    0    1    2    3    4     5            XX
    3202              :                  *    TIME STAMPS : ISO 9660 Standard 9.1.5.
    3203              :                  *                  If TF_LONG_FORM FLAGS is set,
    3204              :                  *                  use ISO9660 Standard 8.4.26.1.
    3205              :                  */
    3206              : #define TF_CREATION     0x01    /* Creation time recorded               */
    3207              : #define TF_MODIFY       0x02    /* Modification time recorded           */
    3208              : #define TF_ACCESS       0x04    /* Last Access time recorded            */
    3209              : #define TF_ATTRIBUTES   0x08    /* Last Attribute Change time recorded  */
    3210              : #define TF_BACKUP       0x10    /* Last Backup time recorded            */
    3211              : #define TF_EXPIRATION   0x20    /* Expiration time recorded             */
    3212              : #define TF_EFFECTIVE    0x40    /* Effective time recorded              */
    3213              : #define TF_LONG_FORM    0x80    /* ISO 9660 17-byte time format used    */

    3215              : 
    3216            0 :                 length = 5;
    3217            0 :                 tf_flags = 0;
    3218              : #ifndef COMPAT_MKISOFS

    3220            0 :                     archive_entry_birthtime(file->entry) <=
    3221            0 :                     archive_entry_mtime(file->entry)) {
    3222            0 :                         length += 7;
    3223            0 :                         tf_flags |= TF_CREATION;
    3224              :                 }

    3275              :         /* Write "RE" System Use Entry. */

    3369            0 :                         bp[4] = 1;      /* version      */

    3373            0 :                         bp += length;

    3375            0 :                 extra_tell_used_size(&ctl, length);

    3377              : 
    3378              :         /* Write "ZF" System Use Entry. */
    3379            0 :         if (file->zisofs.header_size) {

    3381              :                  *   "ZF" Format:

    3387              :                  *    +--------------------+-------------------+

    3389              :                  *    +--------------------+-------------------+
    3390              :                  *    7                    8                   16
    3391              :                  */
    3392            0 :                 length = 16;

    3423              : 
    3424              : /*
    3425              :  * Write data of a Directory Record or calculate writing bytes itself.
    3426              :  * If parameter `p' is NULL, calculates the size of writing data, which
    3427              :  * a Directory Record needs to write, then it saved and return
    3428              :  * the calculated size.
    3429              :  * Parameter `n' is a remaining size of buffer. when parameter `p' is
    3430              :  * not NULL, check whether that `n' is not less than the saved size.
    3431              :  * if that `n' is small, return zero.
    3432              :  *
    3433              :  * This format of the Directory Record is according to
    3434              :  * ISO9660 Standard 9.1
    3435              :  */
    3436              : static int
    3437            0 : set_directory_record(unsigned char *p, size_t n, struct isoent *isoent,
    3438              :     struct iso9660 *iso9660, enum dir_rec_type t,
    3439              :     enum vdd_type vdd_type)
    3440              : {
    3441            0 :         unsigned char *bp;
    3442            0 :         size_t dr_len;
    3443            0 :         size_t fi_len;
    3444              : 
    3445            0 :         if (p != NULL) {
    3446              :                 /*
    3447              :                  * Check whether a write buffer size is less than the
    3448              :                  * saved size which is needed to write this Directory
    3449              :                  * Record.
    3450              :                  */
    3451            0 :                 switch (t) {
    3452            0 :                 case DIR_REC_VD:
    3453            0 :                         dr_len = isoent->dr_len.vd; break;
    3454            0 :                 case DIR_REC_SELF:
    3455            0 :                         dr_len = isoent->dr_len.self; break;
    3456            0 :                 case DIR_REC_PARENT:
    3457            0 :                         dr_len = isoent->dr_len.parent; break;
    3458            0 :                 case DIR_REC_NORMAL:
    3459              :                 default:
    3460            0 :                         dr_len = isoent->dr_len.normal; break;
    3461              :                 }
    3462            0 :                 if (dr_len > n)
    3463              :                         return (0);/* Needs more buffer size. */
    3464              :         }
    3465              : 
    3466            0 :         if (t == DIR_REC_NORMAL && isoent->identifier != NULL)
    3467            0 :                 fi_len = isoent->id_len;
    3468              :         else
    3469              :                 fi_len = 1;
    3470              : 
    3471            0 :         if (p != NULL) {
    3472            0 :                 struct isoent *xisoent;

    3474            0 :                 unsigned char flag;
    3475              : 
    3476            0 :                 if (t == DIR_REC_PARENT)
    3477            0 :                         xisoent = isoent->parent;
    3478              :                 else
    3479              :                         xisoent = isoent;

    3481            0 :                 if (file->hardlink_target != NULL)
    3482            0 :                         file = file->hardlink_target;

    3485              :                         flag = FILE_FLAG_DIRECTORY;

    3487            0 :                         if (file->cur_content->next != NULL)

    3490            0 :                                 flag = 0;

    3605              : /*
    3606              :  * Manage to write ISO-image data with wbuff to reduce calling
    3607              :  * __archive_write_output() for performance.
    3608              :  */
    3609              : 
    3610              : 
    3611              : static inline unsigned char *
    3612            0 : wb_buffptr(struct archive_write *a)
    3613              : {
    3614            0 :         struct iso9660 *iso9660 = (struct iso9660 *)a->format_data;
    3615              : 
    3616            0 :         return (&(iso9660->wbuff[sizeof(iso9660->wbuff)
    3617            0 :                 - iso9660->wbuff_remaining]));
    3618              : }
    3619              : 
    3620              : static int
    3621            0 : wb_write_out(struct archive_write *a)
    3622              : {
    3623            0 :         struct iso9660 *iso9660 = (struct iso9660 *)a->format_data;
    3624            0 :         size_t wsize, nw;
    3625            0 :         int r;
    3626              : 
    3627            0 :         wsize = sizeof(iso9660->wbuff) - iso9660->wbuff_remaining;
    3628            0 :         nw = wsize % LOGICAL_BLOCK_SIZE;
    3629            0 :         if (iso9660->wbuff_type == WB_TO_STREAM)
    3630            0 :                 r = __archive_write_output(a, iso9660->wbuff, wsize - nw);
    3631              :         else
    3632            0 :                 r = write_to_temp(a, iso9660->wbuff, wsize - nw);
    3633              :         /* Increase the offset. */
    3634            0 :         iso9660->wbuff_offset += wsize - nw;

    3636            0 :                 iso9660->wbuff_written = iso9660->wbuff_offset;

    3641              :         }

    3643              : }
    3644              : 
    3645              : static int

    3850              :                 vdc = VDC_UCS2;
    3851              :                 break;

    3855            0 :                 vdc = VDC_LOWERCASE;
    3856            0 :                 break;

    3858              :         default:
    3859            0 :                 vdt = VDT_PRIMARY;
    3860            0 :                 vd_ver = fst_ver = 1;
    3861              : #ifdef COMPAT_MKISOFS
    3862              :                 vdc = VDC_LOWERCASE;
    3863              : #else
    3864            0 :                 vdc = VDC_STD;
    3865              : #endif
    3866            0 :                 break;
    3867              :         }
    3868              : 
    3869            0 :         bp = wb_buffptr(a) -1;
    3870              :         /* Volume Descriptor Type */
    3871            0 :         set_VD_bp(bp, vdt, vd_ver);
    3872              :         /* Unused Field */
    3873            0 :         set_unused_field_bp(bp, 8, 8);

    4303              : static int

    4325              : static int

    4691              : static void
    4692              : cleanup_backslash_2(wchar_t *p)

    4694              :

    4696              :         while (*p != L'\0') {

    4698              :                         *p = L'/';

    4765              :                 }
    4766              : 
    4767              :                 /*
    4768              :                  * Make sure a path separator is not in the last;
    4769              :                  * Remove trailing '/'.

    4777              : #endif

    4779            0 :                                 u16len -= 2;
    4780              :                         } else
    4781              :                                 break;
    4782              :                 }
    4783              : 
    4784              :                 /*
    4785              :                  * Find a basename in UTF-16BE.
    4786              :                  */
    4787            0 :                 ulast = u16;
    4788            0 :                 u16len >>= 1;
    4789            0 :                 ulen_last = u16len;
    4790            0 :                 while (u16len > 0) {
    4791              : #if defined(_WIN32) || defined(__CYGWIN__)

    4793              : #else

    4795              : #endif

    4799              :                         }

    5780              : /*
    5781              :  * Following idr_* functions are used for resolving duplicated filenames
    5782              :  * and unreceivable filenames to generate ISO9660/Joliet Identifiers.
    5783              :  */
    5784              : 
    5785              : static void
    5786            0 : idr_relaxed_filenames(char *map)
    5787              : {
    5788            0 :         int i;
    5789              : 
    5790            0 :         for (i = 0x21; i <= 0x2F; i++)
    5791            0 :                 map[i] = 1;
    5792            0 :         for (i = 0x3A; i <= 0x41; i++)
    5793            0 :                 map[i] = 1;
    5794            0 :         for (i = 0x5B; i <= 0x5E; i++)
    5795            0 :                 map[i] = 1;
    5796            0 :         map[0x60] = 1;
    5797            0 :         for (i = 0x7B; i <= 0x7E; i++)
    5798            0 :                 map[i] = 1;
    5799            0 : }
    5800              : 
    5801              : static void
    5802            0 : idr_init(struct iso9660 *iso9660, struct vdd *vdd, struct idr *idr)
    5803              : {
    5804              : 
    5805            0 :         idr->idrent_pool = NULL;
    5806            0 :         idr->pool_size = 0;

    5808            0 :                 if (iso9660->opt.iso_level <= 3) {
    5809            0 :                         memcpy(idr->char_map, d_characters_map,
    5810              :                             sizeof(idr->char_map));
    5811              :                 } else {
    5812            0 :                         memcpy(idr->char_map, d1_characters_map,
    5813              :                             sizeof(idr->char_map));
    5814            0 :                         idr_relaxed_filenames(idr->char_map);
    5815              :                 }
    5816              :         }
    5817            0 : }
    5818              : 
    5819              : static void
    5820            0 : idr_cleanup(struct idr *idr)
    5821              : {
    5822            0 :         free(idr->idrent_pool);
    5823              : }
    5824              : 
    5825              : static int
    5826            0 : idr_ensure_poolsize(struct archive_write *a, struct idr *idr,
    5827              :     int cnt)
    5828              : {
    5829              : 
    5830            0 :         if (idr->pool_size < cnt) {
    5831            0 :                 void *p;
    5832            0 :                 const int bk = (1 << 7) - 1;
    5833            0 :                 int psize;
    5834              : 
    5835            0 :                 psize = (cnt + bk) & ~bk;
    5836            0 :                 p = realloc(idr->idrent_pool, sizeof(struct idrent) * psize);
    5837            0 :                 if (p == NULL) {
    5838            0 :                         archive_set_error(&a->archive, ENOMEM,
    5839              :                             "Can't allocate memory");
    5840            0 :                         return (ARCHIVE_FATAL);
    5841              :                 }
    5842            0 :                 idr->idrent_pool = (struct idrent *)p;
    5843            0 :                 idr->pool_size = psize;
    5844              :         }
    5845              :         return (ARCHIVE_OK);
    5846              : }
    5847              :

    6322            0 :                 else if (l == ffmax-4)
    6323            0 :                         noff = ext_off - 2;
    6324              :                 else
    6325              :                         noff = ext_off;

    6327            0 :                 idr_register(idr, np, weight, noff);

    6332              : 
    6333            0 :         return (ARCHIVE_OK);
    6334              : }

    6336              : /*
    6337              :  * This comparing rule is according to ISO9660 Standard 9.3
    6338              :  */
    6339              : static int
    6340            0 : isoent_cmp_iso9660_identifier(const struct isoent *p1, const struct isoent *p2)
    6341              : {
    6342            0 :         const char *s1, *s2;
    6343            0 :         int cmp;
    6344            0 :         int l;
    6345              : 
    6346            0 :         s1 = p1->identifier;
    6347            0 :         s2 = p2->identifier;
    6348              : 
    6349              :         /* Compare File Name */
    6350            0 :         l = p1->ext_off;
    6351            0 :         if (l > p2->ext_off)
    6352              :                 l = p2->ext_off;
    6353            0 :         cmp = memcmp(s1, s2, l);
    6354            0 :         if (cmp != 0)
    6355              :                 return (cmp);
    6356            0 :         if (p1->ext_off < p2->ext_off) {
    6357            0 :                 s2 += l;
    6358            0 :                 l = p2->ext_off - p1->ext_off;

    6362            0 :                                     - *(const unsigned char *)(s2 - 1));

    6367            0 :                         if (0x20 != *s1++)
    6368            0 :                                 return (*(const unsigned char *)(s1 - 1)
    6369            0 :                                     - 0x20);
    6370              :         }

    6373              :                 return (0);

    6734              : static int
    6735            0 : isoent_rr_move(struct archive_write *a)

    6796              : 
    6797              : /*
    6798              :  * This comparing rule is according to ISO9660 Standard 6.9.1
    6799              :  */
    6800              : static int
    6801              : __LA_LIBC_CC
    6802            0 : _compare_path_table(const void *v1, const void *v2)
    6803              : {
    6804            0 :         const struct isoent *p1, *p2;
    6805            0 :         const char *s1, *s2;
    6806            0 :         int cmp, l;
    6807              : 
    6808            0 :         p1 = *((const struct isoent **)(uintptr_t)v1);
    6809            0 :         p2 = *((const struct isoent **)(uintptr_t)v2);
    6810              : 
    6811              :         /* Compare parent directory number */
    6812            0 :         cmp = p1->parent->dir_number - p2->parent->dir_number;
    6813            0 :         if (cmp != 0)
    6814              :                 return (cmp);
    6815              : 
    6816              :         /* Compare identifier */
    6817            0 :         s1 = p1->identifier;
    6818            0 :         s2 = p2->identifier;
    6819            0 :         l = p1->ext_off;
    6820            0 :         if (l > p2->ext_off)
    6821              :                 l = p2->ext_off;
    6822            0 :         cmp = strncmp(s1, s2, l);
    6823            0 :         if (cmp != 0)
    6824              :                 return (cmp);

    6826            0 :                 s2 += l;

    6829            0 :                         if (0x20 != *s2++)
    6830            0 :                                 return (0x20
    6831            0 :                                     - *(const unsigned char *)(s2 - 1));
    6832            0 :         } else if (p1->ext_off > p2->ext_off) {
    6833            0 :                 s1 += l;
    6834            0 :                 l = p1->ext_off - p2->ext_off;

    6836            0 :                         if (0x20 != *s1++)

    6838            0 :                                     - 0x20);

    6843              : static int

    6984            0 : isoent_make_path_table(struct archive_write *a)

    6986            0 :         struct iso9660 *iso9660 = a->format_data;

    6989              :

    6991              :          * Init Path Table.
    6992              :          */

    6994            0 :             (!iso9660->opt.limit_depth || iso9660->opt.iso_level == 4))

    6996              :                     iso9660->dircnt_max + 1);
    6997              :         else
    6998              :                 /* The number of levels in the hierarchy cannot exceed
    6999              :                  * eight. */

    7001              :                     MAX_DEPTH);

    7003              :                 return (r);

    7006            0 :                     iso9660->dircnt_max + 1);

    7008              :                         return (r);
    7009              :         }
    7010              :

    7012              :          * - Collect directories for primary and joliet.

    7238              : 
    7239              : /*
    7240              :  * Make a boot catalog image data.
    7241              :  */
    7242              : static int
    7243            0 : make_boot_catalog(struct archive_write *a)
    7244              : {
    7245            0 :         struct iso9660 *iso9660 = a->format_data;
    7246            0 :         unsigned char *block;
    7247            0 :         unsigned char *p;
    7248            0 :         uint16_t sum, *wp;
    7249              : 
    7250            0 :         block = wb_buffptr(a);
    7251            0 :         memset(block, 0, LOGICAL_BLOCK_SIZE);
    7252            0 :         p = block;
    7253              :         /*
    7254              :          * Validation Entry
    7255              :          */
    7256              :         /* Header ID */
    7257            0 :         p[0] = 1;
    7258              :         /* Platform ID */
    7259            0 :         p[1] = iso9660->el_torito.platform_id;
    7260              :         /* Reserved */
    7261            0 :         p[2] = p[3] = 0;
    7262              :         /* ID */
    7263            0 :         if (archive_strlen(&(iso9660->el_torito.id)) > 0)
    7264            0 :                 strncpy((char *)p+4, iso9660->el_torito.id.s, 23);
    7265            0 :         p[27] = 0;
    7266              :         /* Checksum */
    7267            0 :         p[28] = p[29] = 0;
    7268              :         /* Key */
    7269            0 :         p[30] = 0x55;
    7270            0 :         p[31] = 0xAA;
    7271              : 
    7272            0 :         sum = 0;
    7273            0 :         wp = (uint16_t *)block;
    7274            0 :         while (wp < (uint16_t *)&block[32])
    7275            0 :                 sum += archive_le16dec(wp++);
    7276            0 :         set_num_721(&block[28], (~sum) + 1);
    7277              : 
    7278              :         /*
    7279              :          * Initial/Default Entry
    7280              :          */
    7281            0 :         p = &block[32];
    7282              :         /* Boot Indicator */
    7283            0 :         p[0] = 0x88;
    7284              :         /* Boot media type */
    7285            0 :         p[1] = iso9660->el_torito.media_type;
    7286              :         /* Load Segment */
    7287            0 :         if (iso9660->el_torito.media_type == BOOT_MEDIA_NO_EMULATION)

    7501              : static void
    7502            0 : zisofs_detect_magic(struct archive_write *a, const void *buff, size_t s)

    7504            0 :         struct iso9660 *iso9660 = a->format_data;

    7514            0 :         int64_t entry_size;
    7515              :

    7522            0 :         if (iso9660->zisofs.magic_cnt == 0 && s >= (size_t)magic_max)

    7527            0 :                         size_t l;

    7537              :                                 return;

    7540              :         }
    7541            0 :         iso9660->zisofs.detect_magic = 0;
    7542            0 :         p = magic_buff;

    7544              :         /* Check the magic code of zisofs. */

    7550              :         /* Read a zisofs header. */

    7563              :                 return;/* Invalid data. */

    7570            0 :                 if (bst != doff)
    7571              :                         return;/* Invalid data. */

    7575              :                         return;/* Invalid data. */

    7593              : static int
    7594            0 : zisofs_write_to_temp(struct archive_write *a, const void *buff, size_t s)

    7601            0 :         int flush, r;
    7602              : 
    7603            0 :         zstrm = &(iso9660->zisofs.stream);
    7604            0 :         zstrm->next_out = wb_buffptr(a);
    7605            0 :         zstrm->avail_out = (uInt)wb_remaining(a);
    7606            0 :         b = (const unsigned char *)buff;
    7607            0 :         do {
    7608            0 :                 avail = ZF_BLOCK_SIZE - zstrm->total_in;
    7609            0 :                 if (s < avail) {
    7610            0 :                         avail = s;
    7611            0 :                         flush = Z_NO_FLUSH;
    7612              :                 } else

    7614            0 :                 iso9660->zisofs.remaining -= avail;

    7616            0 :                         flush = Z_FINISH;

    7618            0 :                 zstrm->next_in = (Bytef *)(uintptr_t)(const void *)b;

    7623              :                  */

    7631            0 :                                         break;

    7633              :                 }
    7634            0 :                 b += avail;

    7636              : 
    7637              :                 /*

    7645            0 :                                 int64_t diff;
    7646              : 
    7647            0 :                                 r = wb_set_offset(a,
    7648            0 :                                     file->cur_content->offset_of_temp +
    7649              :                                         iso9660->zisofs.block_offset);
    7650            0 :                                 if (r != ARCHIVE_OK)
    7651            0 :                                         return (r);
    7652            0 :                                 diff = file->cur_content->size -
    7653            0 :                                     iso9660->zisofs.block_offset;
    7654            0 :                                 file->cur_content->size -= diff;
    7655            0 :                                 iso9660->zisofs.total_size -= diff;
    7656              :                         }
    7657            0 :                         zstrm->avail_in = 0;
    7658              :                 }
    7659              : 
    7660              :                 /*

    7662              :                  */

    7664            0 :                         csize = zstrm->total_out;
    7665            0 :                         r = deflate(zstrm, flush);
    7666            0 :                         switch (r) {

    7669            0 :                                 csize = zstrm->total_out - csize;

    7676            0 :                                 break;

    7678            0 :                                 archive_set_error(&a->archive,
    7679              :                                     ARCHIVE_ERRNO_MISC,

    7681              :                                     " deflate() call returned status %d",
    7682              :                                     r);
    7683            0 :                                 return (ARCHIVE_FATAL);
    7684              :                         }

    7686              : 
    7687            0 :                 if (flush == Z_FINISH) {
    7688              :                         /*
    7689              :                          * Save the information of one zisofs block.
    7690              :                          */
    7691            0 :                         iso9660->zisofs.block_pointers_idx ++;

    7693            0 :                             iso9660->zisofs.block_pointers_idx]),

    7702              : 
    7703              :         return (ARCHIVE_OK);
    7704              : }
    7705              : 
    7706              : static int
    7707            0 : zisofs_finish_entry(struct archive_write *a)
    7708              : {
    7709            0 :         struct iso9660 *iso9660 = a->format_data;
    7710            0 :         struct isofile *file = iso9660->cur_file;
    7711            0 :         unsigned char buff[16];
    7712            0 :         size_t s;
    7713            0 :         int64_t tail;
    7714              : 
    7715              :         /* Direct temp file stream to zisofs temp file stream. */
    7716            0 :         archive_entry_set_size(file->entry, iso9660->zisofs.total_size);
    7717              : 
    7718              :         /*
    7719              :          * Save a file pointer which points the end of current zisofs data.
    7720              :          */
    7721            0 :         tail = wb_offset(a);
    7722              : 
    7723              :         /*
    7724              :          * Make a header.
    7725              :          *
    7726              :          * +-----------------+----------------+-----------------+
    7727              :          * | Header 16 bytes | Block Pointers | Compressed data |
    7728              :          * +-----------------+----------------+-----------------+
    7729              :          * 0                16               +X
    7730              :          * Block Pointers :
    7731              :          *   4 * (((Uncompressed file size + block_size -1) / block_size) + 1)
    7732              :          *
    7733              :          * Write zisofs header.
    7734              :          *    Magic number
    7735              :          * +----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+
    7736              :          * | 37 | E4 | 53 | 96 | C9 | DB | D6 | 07 |
    7737              :          * +----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+
    7738              :          * 0    1    2    3    4    5    6    7    8
    7739              :          *
    7740              :          * +------------------------+------------------+
    7741              :          * | Uncompressed file size | header_size >> 2 |
    7742              :          * +------------------------+------------------+
    7743              :          * 8                       12                 13
    7744              :          *
    7745              :          * +-----------------+----------------+
    7746              :          * | log2 block_size | Reserved(0000) |
    7747              :          * +-----------------+----------------+
    7748              :          * 13               14               16
    7749              :          */
    7750            0 :         memcpy(buff, zisofs_magic, 8);
    7751            0 :         set_num_731(buff+8, file->zisofs.uncompressed_size);

    7796              : struct zisofs_extract {
    7797              :         int              pz_log2_bs; /* Log2 of block size */
    7798              :         uint64_t         pz_uncompressed_size;
    7799              :         size_t           uncompressed_buffer_size;
    7800              : 
    7801              :         unsigned int     initialized:1;
    7802              :         unsigned int     header_passed:1;
    7803              : 
    7804              :         uint32_t         pz_offset;

    7815              : static ssize_t
    7816            0 : zisofs_extract_init(struct archive_write *a, struct zisofs_extract *zisofs,
    7817              :     const unsigned char *p, size_t bytes)
    7818              : {
    7819            0 :         size_t avail = bytes;
    7820            0 :         size_t _ceil, xsize;
    7821              : 
    7822              :         /* Allocate block pointers buffer. */
    7823            0 :         _ceil = (size_t)((zisofs->pz_uncompressed_size +
    7824            0 :                 (((int64_t)1) << zisofs->pz_log2_bs) - 1)
    7825              :                 >> zisofs->pz_log2_bs);
    7826            0 :         xsize = (_ceil + 1) * 4;
    7827            0 :         if (zisofs->block_pointers == NULL) {
    7828            0 :                 size_t alloc = ((xsize >> 10) + 1) << 10;
    7829            0 :                 zisofs->block_pointers = malloc(alloc);
    7830            0 :                 if (zisofs->block_pointers == NULL) {
    7831            0 :                         archive_set_error(&a->archive, ENOMEM,
    7832              :                             "No memory for zisofs decompression");
    7833            0 :                         return (ARCHIVE_FATAL);
    7834              :                 }
    7835              :         }
    7836            0 :         zisofs->block_pointers_size = xsize;
    7837              : 
    7838              :         /* Allocate uncompressed data buffer. */
    7839            0 :         zisofs->uncompressed_buffer_size = (size_t)1UL << zisofs->pz_log2_bs;

    7841              :         /*
    7842              :          * Read the file header, and check the magic code of zisofs.
    7843              :          */
    7844            0 :         if (!zisofs->header_passed) {
    7845            0 :                 int err = 0;
    7846            0 :                 if (avail < 16) {
    7847            0 :                         archive_set_error(&a->archive,
    7848              :                             ARCHIVE_ERRNO_FILE_FORMAT,
    7849              :                             "Illegal zisofs file body");
    7850            0 :                         return (ARCHIVE_FATAL);
    7851              :                 }
    7852              : 
    7853            0 :                 if (memcmp(p, zisofs_magic, sizeof(zisofs_magic)) != 0)

    7857            0 :                 else if (p[12] != 4 || p[13] != zisofs->pz_log2_bs)

    7861              :                             ARCHIVE_ERRNO_FILE_FORMAT,
    7862              :                             "Illegal zisofs file body");
    7863            0 :                         return (ARCHIVE_FATAL);
    7864              :                 }
    7865            0 :                 avail -= 16;
    7866            0 :                 p += 16;
    7867            0 :                 zisofs->header_passed = 1;
    7868              :         }
    7869              : 
    7870              :         /*
    7871              :          * Read block pointers.
    7872              :          */

    7874            0 :             zisofs->block_pointers_avail < zisofs->block_pointers_size) {
    7875            0 :                 xsize = zisofs->block_pointers_size
    7876              :                     - zisofs->block_pointers_avail;

    7963              : 
    7964              :         /*

    7969              :                  * It's basically 32K bytes NUL data.
